ED87C122FB89423DA5834380BA7BC943.description: Deliver a sales pitch that attempts to persuade someone (using at least 6 of the steps of the selling process) to close a sale of a product or service. *You can use a DECA or FBLA Sales Presentation or create your own product or service.

B3D8609DC55C45068510FBAF7511D5FF.description: Students will be able to research career opportunities within the seven functions of marketing and demonstrate the skills necessary for success in the industry including: accountability, communication, dependability, teamwork, critical thinking, and problem solving.

02D13A62B71E4D21902B91413A18C6FE.description: Create a promotional plan for a company or product/service that considers the 4 P’s and identifies the target market.

587D78223FAD4B63A9AB3F97EA3C894C.description: Create a digital marketing advertisement that promotes a product and incorporates one of the above pricing strategies.

CE56BCEA7FAE4F42A3A2639AF6A75269.description: Conduct primary and/or secondary research and analyze results for a real-life marketing problem with a community partner.

A959F67B5F28402D9A250A2673AEFF7C.description: Students will be able demonstrate communication, problem solving, teamwork, and critical thinking skills as they work towards finding solutions to a case study.

00FB0CAB0B72424383724BFFEA16A9C1.description: Performance Skills: Choose 4 of the 6 marketing performance indicators (note: using DECA or FBLA events as a resource to fulfill objectives is encouraged)

01D534FBDE634BBFA5C715262D25DEBB.description: Define common sales enablement tools and how they promote smart business practices

AD998DF3072C4F12B1E871776D03752D.description: Sales enablement is the activities, systems, processes, and information that support and promote knowledge-based sales interactions with clients and prospects.

04F370A266F94C9EBB5B100CB1E1604A.description: Follow up (sales pipeline management, endless-chain method, asking for referrals from satisfied customers)

3CC7A09D39724568B9B36776FEAB5434.description: Suggestion selling: a sales technique where an employee asks a customer if they would like to include an additional purchase that might suit the customer.

9EF136D0AD954B16BA7BB442D9725A22.description: Close the sale by converting the potential customer into a customer sales

06F1BB3D027B4B52A45B58A8414E2E76.description: Overcome the customer’s objections by going back through the benefits to the customer

1A9AF167C9634CD2ADF35BA01949BB0C.description: Present the product (both features and benefits)

79087DA153864AC28E3AE539C3372B16.description: Determine customer needs by asking helpful questions

6E88C60A246C486FBB104D584076265C.description: Explain the steps of the selling process including:

3A7BAF9E543240C983354749D178C787.description: Understanding that conversion rate, is the percentage of users that take the desired action, is a main metric used in sales.

D650452AC3B4483AA8764AFB94EED99C.description: Research tactics to identify valuable information about potential prospects, determining decision maker contacts and overcoming common objections.

444D23F9FCCF4DBE9BF6FAC494C82917.description: Explain the importance of preparing for the sale by applying product knowledge of features and benefits.

58BB0AB6E77E46489E8582B54B12A0DE.description: Explain the role of relationship building as a component of selling.

7E278BAEE6284D5D9847E96BA4ED6C88.description: Explain the role of selling as a marketing function

26E701B99F274CE388F96DF87926AFCE.description: Students will understand the concept of Selling as the strategies and process to convince a potential customer to purchase a product or service and to remain a loyal customer.

6BC0F2A04060455D947FAE4F9A105C18.description: Describe the importance of international distribution channels. Disruptions in one area (Suez canal, Panama canal, Strait of Gibraltar) can have ripple effects throughout many markets.

E8FFFE77B4354142ADB4CA470CF4AB7D.description: Identify the methods of transportation for products including: trucks, air, ship, and rail.

A2C5642BC27348C18D837C61CA85A148.description: Recognize the impact of inventory and delivery systems (e.g. Just-In-Time, automated inventory, same day, next day, and two-day)

995ECA5666F241D29ECD767CFE8FA7FB.description: Define a channel of distribution as the network used to get a product from the manufacturer/ creator to the consumer (B2C) or industrial user (B2B). This may include agents, wholesalers, retailers, distributors, online retailers or end users through direct and indirect channels.

6FC6EB19B09E4326AF000C3E61678A56.description: Identify methods of product channel management.

F44E4643DD854EF4B4192C245AFBE1B5.description: Students will understand the concept of Product Channel Management as the strategies to distribute products to consumers.

376BF9C9E4E84FAD9ED3A933B5B95842.description: Discuss examples of sales promotions which include: subscriptions, coupons, loyalty programs, samples, premiums, sponsorship, and product placement.

77F60D19F54C422F83680FF4365AECE8.description: Determining a customers preferred communication styles and preferences (email, chat, phone, telephony, or in-person)

9FF651E1E0404D28AEC53227699CAD92.description: Identify public-relations activities including a press release: is a written communication that reports specific but brief information about an event, circumstance, product launch, or other happening and publicity: is any promotional communication regarding a company or its products where the message is not paid for by the organization often benefiting from it.

B52955125FA340769789AB8573C54366.description: Broadcast and streaming: TV, radio, YouTube, Spotify, Netflix, Amazon, Hulu

77CC041A7CA04A4585560076C475CA30.description: Digital Media: pay per click, e-mail, in apps, social media, texting, and push notifications

CB43E70B46DE40AEB2BF611115074AB0.description: Print media: billboards, wrapped vehicles, LED tools, newspaper, magazine, direct mailers any medium that is physically printed out.

B7D7869EC1A34ADC85B4B25379FBA434.description: Give examples of advertising media: the means that marketers choose to use to communicate with their target audiences including:

91F24AD6F6EB4E9BB37B83BAC48C04D1.description: Understand promotional channels used to communicate with the target market.

4332019B3B2C400D80A212F2D08F7A4C.description: Explain the importance of creating a brand experience: the essence of what you represent, a company's positioning, and the experience you are trying to deliver at each interaction with your customers.

C7C16D6D848242AD9BCF57286D0BB2E0.description: Define branding as a company name, logo, the design, or a combination used to identify and differentiate itself from the competition. Branding should connect with customers emotionally and motivate them to buy.

69EAE0D6861D4519B78A3BF6B9088267.description: Sales Promotion: marketing technologies aimed to increase the demand in particular products and increase brand awareness

6AECC30DFCC1446B8767F3C753B148B5.description: Selling: is a process of persuasion to get potential customers to take action.

9F343D20893F46E0A3A118DCC8570806.description: Public Relations: is a strategic communication process that builds mutually beneficial relationships for a company and the public or its markets.

9E720DD7A13D4E468C84F90DF510A018.description: Advertising: the act or practice of calling public attention to one's product or service.

F7458A0CE1AE4B51862C222CE7EB67BA.description: Identify elements of the promotional mix including:

DC47F9D9C0E94937954E26CAFDAC81D4.description: Define promotion: the strategies used to build awareness of a brand and its product.

F5910AD6DFAB4BA18D0C986442059DA5.description: Explain the role of promotion as a marketing function.

051240FCC10A43D4A184ACC900CFA717.description: Students will be able to explain the concept of Promotion.

A478AA2DE7E144E7BBE5C941CD12D56B.description: Decline Stage: during this stage sales decline and consumers lose interest in the product. Companies determine that this product has run its course and is ready to be discontinued. As a last attempt companies may change product packaging to try and revive it.

89582323376F4A4D8BBEDE670B40F6B9.description: Maturity Stage: is when the sales begin to level off from the fast growth of the introduction period. Companies begin to reduce their prices so they can stay competitive amongst growing competition. They now focus on becoming more efficient and their marketing campaigns focus on differentiating themselves from competitors.

E6FBACEBDFB045FBB1A7E7E7BD7E40F8.description: Growth Stage: consumers have accepted the product in the market. That means demand and profits are growing. Competition begins and the marketing team seeks to establish a brand presence so consumers choose them over their competitors. Companies start thinking about new distribution channels, product features and other support services.

46B8FF5D9FCC492181FA865126260B9E.description: Introduction Stage: is when a product is first launched in the marketplace. This is when the marketing team begins building product awareness and reaching out to potential customers. This stage is focused on advertising and marketing campaign implementation.

8EDD806E8D164DA390911F9CCCD64CD5.description: Identify the components of the product life cycle (Development, Introduction, Growth, Maturity, Saturation, and Decline) Describe the different stages and common marketing strategies and goals used during each stage.

B9B16F1951CA4AB59DFAA53FB0246EEF.description: Understand that successful products need to fill a need and/or solve a problem.

1368CC228735462F88A3B720C4C25BF1.description: Understand the importance of generating new products, services or ideas. Explore emerging products in the digital space including the following Software as a Service (SaaS) a way of delivering applications over the Internet—as a service.

B7365B9DF619498EA968966B0A3D7A92.description: Define the concept of product mix including: product lines: A group of closely related product items, product width/breadth: the total number of product lines that a company offers to sell and product depth: is the number of versions of a product that a firm offers.

73304072147A449A95F0640B811561CE.description: Explain the role of product/service management as a marketing function

E605C2AAE4764D8998AB4602D41FF3C1.description: Students will understand the concept of Product Service Management: the strategies used to create, maintain, improve, and add to a product and service mix.

21A6640E6C9E46D298C67E525D61E545.description: Discuss how businesses use pricing strategies to attract customers and create value. (Strategies may include: odd/even pricing, loss leaders, prestige pricing, penetration pricing, price bundling, price lining, or everyday low pricing.)

46C50AC47C484B188CD78EB58DC86C8A.description: supply and demand--defined as the interaction between seller and the buyer. Generally, as price

93BE44B9BC9F4531AAC98B45D5B5E209.description: break-even point--defined as the point when sales revenue (income) equals the cost (expenses) of making and distributing the product.

8FE35831632A402A80B69E3AAFA39227.description: Explain the impact on price of the economic principles of:

6459ECCF88724EB0A55752B2F155BCE6.description: Identify diverse factors affecting price such as: perceived value, competitor pricing, convenience for customers, costs (distribution costs, employee costs) & expenses (determine profit margin)

7E847A86DD9647A8B9B5B194F2D44432.description: Identify goals for pricing: which include profit, market share and competition

98A0A6A43D9F4B6AB8EF64AF17E74DA0.description: Understand how businesses make pricing decisions.

86C806D4945C41E3B65850F2C4EFDBB8.description: Students will understand the concept of pricing as the strategies used to determine customer perception of value for a product or service with the ultimate goal to maximize profit.

3D73CB5F15864D588B2C0CD1E16E6D80.description: Explore and discuss utilizing market information to make business decisions. Recognize that gathering data is only valuable when it is utilized for product improvement, finding new customers, and/or improving brand experience.

824B90B475C146EDAEAB32895971C643.description: Define Secondary Research as purchased or contracted research that has been gathered by another company. This data may be purchased from any number of sources including companies such as Adobe, Qualtrics and Google, government agencies or even industry researchers and analysts.

2AD84837937341EBAA52267DC2F00CB2.description: Define Primary Research as original research conducted to collect data specifically for a current objective. Examples may include conducting a survey, running an interview or a focus group, observing behavior, or doing an experiment. Primary research may utilize digital channels like emails, apps and in app purchasing. The researcher obtains this raw data directly and collects it specifically for current research needs.

3E1F588E454549B8A421AC7E67B3C141.description: Identify how marketing information from primary and secondary sources influences marketing decisions

8B17DCE24D564C35A11CE52307BF84A2.description: Students will understand the concept of marketing information management: as the need to gather and evaluate information for use in making business decisions.

EBFFA0EC7FED4AF1A8242FDD414B5428.description: Behavioral; How? (Looking at the benefits desired by consumers such as shopping patterns, usage rate, benefits--and not just the physical characteristics of a product)

AA6B1C7BB9704FC3B742AAC6AA2961EB.description: Psychographics/Interests; Why? (Involves grouping people with similar lifestyles, as well as shared attitudes, values, and opinions such as Activities, Attitudes, Personality & Values)

8D661E0E74F44B58AD88A5E8BEC4ED80.description: Geographics/Location; Where? (Segmentation based on where people live such as Natural or Political Boundaries, Climate, Cultural influences, and Customs)

5C1C68D2317B4727A498C0A9355F29B6.description: Demographics; Who? (Personal characteristics such as Age, Gender, Income Level, Education Level, Race, Ethnicity)

AFECF015984D4616AA64304238D89248.description: Target marketing, focusing all marketing efforts on a very specific group of people through implementation of Marketing Segmentation which is the process of dividing a market of potential customers into specific groups based on different characteristics

EAE32457C07E4E3C869BD587D4A54173.description: Situational Analysis (e.g. SWOT) - evaluating the internal and external factors of a business through market research to identify an organization’s current strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.

D7E9CB57914E491986881EF95289AF3C.description: Mass Marketing - production and distribution of a product that will appeal to the highest amount of people possible without regard to segmentation

14D3E697ED0B44F9BB6785F54F58B1CF.description: Niche Marketing - promoting and selling a product or service to a specialized segment of a market

F6BC95DBE1194D229A253F1D5F3D9E8A.description: Marketing Share - the specific percentage of total industry sales of a product achieved by a single company in a given period of time

D5931B870D9A45DAA77F858E2F9A98E8.description: Marketing Position - refers to the consumer’s perception of a product in relation to competing products and how it is different

A237E1D004EA49469C12AACE046736D4.description: Marketing Plan - a strategic roadmap that businesses use to organize and track their promotional and financial goals

C428A7AEC62B42BC89AD7547275A4981.description: Students will understand the concept of marketing planning; both the internal and external factors.

1A9999E6004C4750942880E3FA04FA64.description: Explore and find examples of marketing all around us, including marketing-related careers, CTSO’s, case studies, guest speakers, and community partners

2820D40292EC483B86A059C12BAEB83F.description: Explain how each component of the marketing mix contributes to successful marketing.

AFC6C7BB9B73455BAF320E23C8DA9433.description: Promotion - process of communication with customers and potential customers to inform, persuade, and remind about products, their price, and where they can be purchased

6CA7E79AEE6E4EF08744EA5087D6F939.description: Place - activities involved in getting a product or service to the end user, may include: shipping, ordering processing, inventory storage, and stocking of goods. Describe that place can be both a physical location or online site.

38751E5424BF4C0390C8D757073F18D3.description: Price - amount of money requested or exchanged for a product, should cover expenses and allow for a profit

DAAE1E4E0D6448F39C111216B44B559A.description: Product - possibly the most important, can be a good, and service.

E6DA0D3800F04A63A598BF7413B385C9.description: Identify the four elements of the marketing mix.

8FC971276C534C7DBFFBBA19AACEECF6.description: Understand the marketing mix or 4P's of marketing.

1635E8154BAF40C8A687EEAB911F1FF0.description: Selling - All personal communication with customers such as Helping customers in a store, Making sales or product demonstrations, Providing any form of customer service

3B3F2FB3270844B6B47EF484F6D1A078.description: Product Channel Management - a route a product takes from a product to a customer, on-time delivery, transferring product ownership, and where products are sold

B3A7D86A3DFC493B83644E61DE09AC5C.description: Promotion - Communicating with customers in an effort to influence behavior. All communication from an organization to a customer is considered promotion such as Personal selling, Advertising, Sales promotion, and Public relations

213215619D154EC38A9CBE7DBFF8BB83.description: Product Service Management - Determining which products a business should offer to meet customer needs, possibly developing of a new product, and improving a current product such as Brands, Quantities, Colors, Sizes, Features

A169CE49D29C4C9B80E298E145086B48.description: Pricing - using financial information to see prices that cover costs and allow for a profit, researching and analyzing pricing of competitors, and adjusting prices as needed

15FD4F86F2CD45959235FB2B4017D15E.description: Marketing Information Management - gathering and analyzing information about: markets, customers, industry trends, competing businesses, and new technology

5D84BBC0361D48D29BE958A7D1D81908.description: Market Planning - identifying target market, determining appropriate marketing strategies, setting and measuring budget effectiveness

3F21C58A793F43CDA31B71B9EC8D8E84.description: Understand that marketing includes the following seven core functions:

F4BFFE689FDB473B92C618AEDF2F4BB3.description: Define marketing as added value, a way to connect a business’ products and services to customers who want and need them and have the ability to buy. Then identify the seven core functions.

A013310AB54C4BF78AA3846D70A1BA40.description: Students will understand the principles of marketing including the seven core functions, the 4P’s of the marketing mix and their practical application found in workplace settings and CTSOs.
